Original Author: Rodrigo Zechin Rosauro 
https://github.com/lkorth/appwall 
 
AppWall - Android Firewall is a front-end application for the powerful iptables Linux firewall. It allows you to restrict which applications are permitted to access your data networks. 
This is the perfect solution if you don't have an unlimited data plan, or just wants to see your battery lasting longer. 
 
Using AppWall: 
1. Click on Mode to switch between White List and Black List modes. 
2. Mark the applications that you want to block or allow (depending on the selected mode), for each interface. 
3. Open the menu and enable the firewall. If the firewall is already enabled, just select Apply rules. 
The rules will be saved and automatically restored when you restart your phone. 
If you want to check all current iptables rules, select Show rules in the menu. 
 
Widget: 
To quickly enable or disable the firewall, add the AppWall widget to your home screen. 
 
Firewall logs: 
If you want to see which applications have been blocked by AppWall, open the menu and enable the Log. 
AppWall will then log each application blocked. You can check the log by opening the menu and selecting More -> Show log.
